titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Grover Batts

Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Lawyer, economist, and diplomat. Correspondence, letterbooks, articles, speeches, financial papers, business records, legal papers, and other papers relating to Steinhardt's career as ambassador to Sweden, Peru, the Soviet Union, Turkey, Czechoslovakia, and Canada.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

subject.part: Diplomatic and consular service, American--Soviet Union.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Laurence A. Steinhardt, lawyer, economist, and diplomat, were given to the Library of Congress by his widow, Dulcie Steinhardt Beau, in 1963. Additional material was given by the American Jewish Archives in 1983.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Steinhardt Papers were processed in 1963. An addition was made circa 1983 and the finding aid was revised in 2005 and 2012.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Copyright in the unpublished writings of Laurence A. Steinhardt in these papers and in other collections of papers in the custody of the Library of Congress has been dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Laurence A. Steinhardt are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

accessrestrict.head: Security Classified Documents
accessrestrict.p: Government regulations control the use of security classified material in this collection. Manuscript Division staff can furnish information concerning access to and use of classified materials.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Laurence A. Steinhardt Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: A.B., Columbia University, New York, N.Y.

chronitemset.event: M.A. and LL.B., Columbia University, New York, N.Y.

chronitem.event: Member, Guggenheimer, Untermyer and Marshall law firm
Member, Executive Finance Committee, Democratic National Committee and Franklin D. Roosevelt's pre-convention campaign committee
Delegate, Eighth Conference of the Pan-American Union, Lima, Peru

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The papers of Laurence Adolph Steinhardt (1892-1950) span the years 1929-1950, with the bulk of the material focused on his career in the State Department from 1933 until his death in an airplane crash in 1950. Included are correspondence, memoranda, reports, legal and financial records, speeches and writings, printed matter, and miscellaneous material relating to his positions as ambassador to Sweden, Peru, the Soviet Union, Turkey, Czechoslovakia, and Canada.. The papers are organized into five series: General File ; Subject and Legal Files ; Letterbooks ;
Addition ; and Classified .

The General File (formerly titled Miscellaneous) constitutes the bulk of the collection and consists largely of incoming correspondence, embassy reports, writings, and personal material organized by year. The papers also contain personal financial material, files relating to the day-to-day operation of the various embassies to which Steinhardt was assigned, and a small number of articles and speeches.

Included among the many notable correspondents in the collection are George V. Allen, Anthony Joseph Drexel Biddle, Joseph Edward Davies, James A. Farley, Loy W. Henderson, Cordell Hull, C. D. Jackson, Alfred A. Knopf, Ruth Bryan Owen, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Edward R. Stettinius, Arthur Hays Sulzberger, and Sumner Welles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in five series:

scopecontent.p: Correspondence (largely incoming), memoranda, reports, financial papers, drafts and printed copies of articles and speeches, clippings, cards and invitations, and printed matter.

arrangement.p: Arranged by year and therein alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Articles and other material, regarding Middle East reports on War Refugee Board and evacuation of Jews from Europe

scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, legal and financial records.

did.unittitle: Czechoslovakia and Poland, reports and clippings, 1947
Stockholm Enskilda Bank, correspondence and cancelled checks, 1933-1937

scopecontent.p: Bound volumes of carbon copies of outgoing letters.

arrangement.p: Family letters are arranged chronologically; general correspondence is arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches, writings, clippings, and miscellany.
Newspaper articles, clippings, and unidentified and undated material.

did.unittitle: Newspaper articles, clippings, and unidentified and undated material

arrangement.p: Arranged and described according to the series, container, and folder from which the items were removed.
